pages.text: It is as if all my senses have expanded. I can $(o)feel$() the energy released from the $(item)Sporebrush$(). No, not released. $(o)Converted$(). This new $(thing)sight$() has revealed more to me of the $(item)Sporebrush$() than I could ever hope to learn on my own. In truth, there are $(key)three forms$() of this magic, each of which $(key)depend on the others$(). Their names are clear in my head, like I always knew them.

This magic is known as $(thing)Haustor$(), and it is the $(key)lifeblood$() of the world as we know it. $(thing)Primordial Haustor$(), or Primordia, is plentiful no matter where you go, but isn't noticeable on its own. When $(item)Sporebrush$() is burned, it converts that primordia into $(thing)Hypha$(), which is volatile and disperses quickly. Lastly is $(thing)Lamellan Haustor$(), which is still a mystery to me. Perhaps I can come about it by $(key)exploring what I can do with my new capabilities$().

The $(item)ring$() is now tightly bound to my finger. I don't think I can remove it without significant effort. I feel like I hear a faint $(key)whispering$() all around me - from the plants, animals, $(thing)fungi$(), and everything else. It's like $(key)Nature itself is trying to speak to me$(). I wish I could even begin to understand what it was trying to say, but I $(key)don't know nearly enough$() at this point to be able to comprehend its meaning.

My mind keeps returning to the $(item)ashes$() left over from burning Sporebrush. They still have so much $(key)potential$() in them, even after being burnt. There might be $(key)remnants of Nature's will$() within them still. Perhaps I can use this to $(key)communicate$() with them. I wonder what would happen if I $(key)scattered ashes across podzol$() and $(key)shared my will to them through the Haustoral Band$()...
